title: 820-01949 not turn on
message:
History? 

PP3v3_G3H is basically the VDD main rail which powers the PMU. The PMU powers the T2, which talks to the CD3217 USB C controllers. 

What do you ask yourself if you find a missing voltage? Is it shorted! 

Find out, and get back to us.

title: 820-01949 not turn on
message: To avoid any missunderstood, do you talk about L7660 (3V3_G3H), or L6900/1 (3V3_G3H_RTC)?

title: 820-01949 not turn on

l7600=0v          mode diode 0.423

title: 820-01949 not turn on
message: If no important data on its SSD, do DFU restore.

title: 820-01949 not turn on
message:
Try several times DFU revive and restore.
Check if SSD and G3S voltages appear.

Just in case, reflash U4770 and try again.
Don't forget to make backup in such case.

title: 820-01949 not turn on
message:
Mira en la pagina 75.
Despues encuentra componentes que te permitan medir lo que necesitas.

Igual para SSD; una barra de tension con "SSD" en su nombre, donde crees que va?
Habitualmente en las paginas dedicadas al SSD; 71 quizas?

title: 820-01949 not turn on
message:
Aveces las tensiones G3S y SSD aparecen despues de varios intentos DFU revive/restore.
Si flashear U4770 tampoco ayuda, no hay mas esperanzas...

title: 820-01949 not turn on
message: muchas gracias .Y esos chip CD3217B12 en que casos tu los cambias, para este caso no aplica cierto.

title: 820-01949 not turn on
message:
If USB-C inputs switch all to 20V, the CD3217 chips should be good.
There may be a communication problem with external USB device, but good communication with the charger at least; not usual case at all.

If you have different behavior between USB-C charging ports, there could still be a bad CD3217 chip.

title: 820-01949 not turn on
message: sorry for the question as a flash chip if it is not present on the board.I found a small corrosion near this chip, it may be that I need to change the chip?[ATTACH type="full" alt="IMG_2509.jpg"]60861[/ATTACH]

title: 820-01949 not turn on
message:
Need to reball that CD3217 chip.
Also clean the corrosion, replace damaged components and rebuild traces, if needed.
